wikipedia_page.main: General Sir James Shaw Kennedy,  (13 October 1788 – 30 May 1865) was a British soldier and military writer.

response: * Sir James Shaw Kennedy (1788–1865), general and military writer
*1854–1865: Gen. Sir James Shaw Kennedy, KCB
* James Shaw Kennedy (1788–1865), born James Shaw, British Army officer of the Napoleonic era
* James Shaw Kennedy (1788–1865), British General and military writer, Knight Commander, Order of the Bath

The 43rd returned to America in 1814 as part of an expeditionary force which initially had some success but was defeated during the Battle of New Orleans by the forces of General Jackson in 1815.Booth, p.51Newbolt, p. 130 The regiment then returned to Europe. The 43rd arrived in Belgium too late to fight in the Battle of Waterloo on 18 June 1815. There were however a number of 43rd officers present during the battle including Lord Fitzroy Somerset and Major James Shaw Kennedy who both served on the Duke of Wellington's staff.Booth, p. 51 The regiment formed part of the army of occupation in France until November 1818.Booth, pp. 59–61
It was named by Major Mitchell in 1836 after General Sir James Shaw Kennedy, a Peninsular War veteran.
